Resolution of lung abscess due to Pseudomonas aeruginosa with oral ciprofloxacin: case report.
 A case of lung abscess due to Pseudomonas aeruginosa is presented that did not resolve with the use of conventional antipseudomonal antibiotics, including tobramycin with ticarcillin-clavulanate and ceftazidime with gentamicin and ticarcillin-clavulanate.
 Oral ciprofloxacin was administered for 12 weeks, and the infection was resolved.
 No resistance occurred, and there was no recurrence of abscess within 18 months following therapy.
